meanings.definition: To change from a liquid to a vapor
meanings.sent1: When the sun shines on the puddle, it evaporates quickly.
meanings.sent2: The morning dew evaporates as the day gets warmer.
meanings.sent3: The spilled juice on the table magically evaporates before our eyes!
meanings.sent4: Her worries seemed to evaporate like mist in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The steam rising from the hot soup pot shows how water evaporates.

meanings.sent1: The footprints in the sand slowly evaporate with each wave.
meanings.sent2: His smile evaporates when he hears the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit in the hat evaporate into thin air!
meanings.sent4: The hope of finding the lost treasure began to evaporate as the days passed.
meanings.sent5: The music filled the room and made all worries evaporate into the night.

meanings.definition: To cause to disappear or fade away
meanings.sent1: The warm breeze can evaporate the morning mist in no time.
meanings.sent2: His harsh words evaporated her enthusiasm for the project.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers can evaporate any evil plans in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness evaporated the tension in the room like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement can evaporate any doubts students may have.
